DataElement.preferredName: Paraaortic Lymph Node Paracaval Lymph Node Dissection Positive Finding Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown indicator that asks whether lymph nodes in the paraaortic and paracaval regions were removed according to a surgical dissection technique had a positive finding.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Paraaortic Lymph Node Paracaval Lymph Node Dissection Positive Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine._A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine, along the right lateral aspect of the inferior vena cava._The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure._A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Paraaortic Lymph Node Paracaval Lymph Node
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine.:A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine, along the right lateral aspect of the inferior vena cava.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine.
A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine, along the right lateral aspect of the inferior vena cava.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.:A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.
